revision.text:
{{Infobox person | name = Noël Wells | image = Noël Wells (cropped).jpg | caption = Wells in November 2015 | birth_name = Noël Kristi Wells | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1986|12|23}} | birth_place = [[San Antonio]], [[Texas]], U.S. | education = [[Memorial High School (Victoria, Texas)|Memorial High School]] | alma_mater = [[University of Texas at Austin]] | years_active = 2010–present | occupation = Actress, director, writer, musician, comedian | residence = [[New York City]], [[New York (state)|New York]], U.S.
[[Los Angeles]], [[California]], U.S. }} '''Noël Kristi Wells''' (born December 23, 1986)[https://familysearch.org/ark:/61903/1:1:VDVB-YHY]{{cite web |url=http://www.nbc.com/saturday-night-live/about/bio/cast/noel-wells/796035/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130921162832/http://www.nbc.com/saturday-night-live/about/bio/cast/noel-wells/796035/ |dead-url=yes |archive-date=2013-09-21 |title=Noel Wells Bio | Featured Player | Saturday Night Live |publisher=NBC |date= |accessdate=2013-09-29 |df= }} is an American actress, comedian, director, musician, and writer. She is known for her television roles on ''[[Master of None]]'' and ''[[Saturday Night Live]]'', as well as writing, directing, and starring in the film ''[[Mr. Roosevelt (film)|Mr. Roosevelt]]''. ==Early life== Wells was born in [[San Antonio]], [[Texas]].{{cite web|url=http://notcommonpeople.blogspot.com/2010/11/noel-kristi-wells.html|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120527051044/http://notcommonpeople.blogspot.com/2010/11/noel-kristi-wells.html|dead-url=yes|archive-date=27 May 2012|title=Noel Wells|publisher=Notcommonpeople.blogspot.com|accessdate=11 September 2013}} Her father is a [[Tunisian people|Tunisian]] immigrant, and her mother is of half [[Mexicans|Mexican]] descent.{{cite web|url=http://www.cosmopolitan.com/entertainment/tv/a50625/noel-wells-master-of-none-interview/ |title=Noël Wells Master of None Interview |publisher=Cosmopolitan.com |date=2015-12-10 |accessdate=2016-12-20}}{{cite web|author= Sep 12, 2016 3:50PM EDT |url=https://www.colorlines.com/articles/meet-melissa-villasenor-snls-first-latina-cast-member |title=Meet Melissa Villaseñor, 'SNL's' First Latina Cast Member |publisher=Colorlines |date=2016-09-12 |accessdate=2016-12-20}}[https://www.washingtonpost.com/lifestyle/style/as-saturday-night-live-cast-reboots-questions-about-diversity-emerge/2013/10/03/b91b7294-2c72-11e3-8ade-a1f23cda135e_story.html "As ‘Saturday Night Live’ cast reboots, questions about diversity emerge"] Paul Farhi, ''[[Washington Post]]'', October 3, 2013. Retrieved June 16, 2014. She says her parents named her Noël because she was born two days before Christmas.{{cite web|url=http://www.tvguide.com/news/saturday-night-live-christmas-noel-wells-1074160.aspx|title=Noël Wells Rings In the Holidays With Saturday Night Live's Christmas Special|work=TV Guide|accessdate=6 October 2014}} She attended [[Memorial High School (Victoria, Texas)|Memorial High School]] in [[Victoria, Texas]], where she was active in speech and debate and graduated as [[salutatorian]].{{cite web|url=http://www.crossroadstoday.com/content/news/local/story/Local-Girl-Makes-Big-Time/B5lOYodhM0O7K2XU02rY0w.cspx?rss=3666|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131005013517/http://www.crossroadstoday.com/content/news/local/story/Local-Girl-Makes-Big-Time/B5lOYodhM0O7K2XU02rY0w.cspx?rss=3666|dead-url=yes|archive-date=2013-10-05|title=Local Girl Makes Big Time|publisher=Crossroadstoday.com|accessdate=2013-10-07}} She graduated from [[University of Texas at Austin]] in 2010{{cite news|last=Abromavitch|first=Seth|title=How 'Saturday Night Live' Found 5 New Castmembers|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/saturday-night-live-new-cast-625424|accessdate=11 September 2013|newspaper=The Hollywood Reporter|date=11 September 2013}} with degrees in Plan II Honors and [[University of Texas at Austin Department of Radio-Television-Film|Radio-Television-Film]].{{cite web|title=RTF Student Noël Wells Thanks Family for IFC Internship|url=http://rtf.utexas.edu/news/rtf-student-noël-wells-thanks-family-ifc-internship?page=2|publisher=Radio Television Film College of Communications}} While attending college, she was a cast member of [[Esther's Follies]],{{cite web|last=Kiest|first=Jim|title=UT grad may join ‘SNL’ cast|url=http://blog.mysanantonio.com/redletter/2013/08/ut-grad-may-join-snl-cast/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131022203835/http://blog.mysanantonio.com/redletter/2013/08/ut-grad-may-join-snl-cast/|dead-url=yes|archive-date=22 October 2013|publisher=My San Antonio|accessdate=11 September 2013}} Austin’s long-running musical satire show, where she performed in sketches and as a magician's assistant.{{cite web|last=Tinkham|first=Chris|title=Noël Wells - 2013 LA Film Fest Interview|url=http://www.undertheradarmag.com/interviews/noel_wells/|publisher=Under the Radar Mag|accessdate=11 September 2013}} Before becoming an actress, she worked as an editor and did motion graphics. ==Career== In 2010, Wells moved to [[Los Angeles]] and performed at the [[Upright Citizens Brigade Theatre]] with the sketch team "New Money".{{cite web|url=http://losangeles.ucbtheatre.com/talent/view/21690|publisher=Upright Citizen Brigade Theater|title=Noel Wells|accessdate=2013-10-07}}{{cite news|last=Seth Abramovitch|first=Seth|title=Cheat Sheet: Get to Know the 5 New Faces of 'SNL'|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/saturday-night-live-get-know-625783|newspaper=The Hollywood Reporter|date=11 September 2013}} She has appeared in numerous [[Cracked.com]] and [[CollegeHumor]] videos,{{cite web|url=http://losangeles.ucbtheatre.com/talent/view/21690|publisher=Upright Citizens Brigade Theater|title=Noel Wells|accessdate=2013-10-07}} and is also known for her own sketch and parody videos, which have over 15 million views on YouTube.{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/noelkristi |title=Noël |publisher=YouTube |date= |accessdate=2013-10-07}} In 2013, Wells joined the cast of ''[[Saturday Night Live]]'' during its [[Saturday Night Live (season 39)|39th]] season as a featured player along with fellow Upright Citizens Brigade performers [[John Milhiser]], [[Kyle Mooney]], and [[Beck Bennett]], as well as writer [[Mike O'Brien (actor)|Mike O'Brien]] and stand-up [[Brooks Wheelan]].{{cite news|last=Carter|first=Bill|title=New Course for ‘Update,’ and All of ‘SNL’|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2013/09/16/business/media/saturday-night-live-setting-its-new-cast.html|accessdate=September 16, 2013|newspaper=[[The New York Times]]|date=September 15, 2013}}{{cite news|last=Andreeva|first=Nellie|title=Michael Patrick O'Brien, Kyle Mooney, Beck Bennett, John Milhiser & Noël Wells Poised to Join ''Saturday Night Live'' Cast|url=http://www.deadline.com/2013/08/john-milhiser-noel-wells-eyed-as-new-saturday-night-live-cast-additions/|newspaper=Deadline Hollywood|accessdate=2013-10-07}}{{cite news|last=Luippold|first=Ross|title='SNL' Cast Rumored To Add Noël Wells, Beck Bennett, John Milhiser, Kyle Mooney, Mike O'Brien (UPDATE)|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2013/08/23/snl-cast-rumor-noel-wells-beck-bennett-john-milhiser-kyle-mooney_n_3805279.html|newspaper=Huffington Post|accessdate=2013-10-07|date=2013-08-23}} On July 15, 2014, it was announced that Wells would not be returning for a second season.{{cite web|url=http://www.deadline.com/2014/07/saturday-night-live-noel-wells-john-milhiser-leaving/|title=Noël Wells & John Milhiser Leaving ‘Saturday Night Live’ - Deadline|date=15 July 2014|work=Deadline|accessdate=6 October 2014}}{{cite web |url=http://www.avclub.com/article/noel-wells-and-john-milhiser-are-also-leaving-satu-206958 |title=Noël Wells and John Milhiser Are Also Leaving ''Saturday Night Live'' |last=O'Neal |first=Sean |date=July 14, 2014 |publisher=[[The A.V. Club]]}} Wells has made guest appearances on television programs such as ''[[The Aquabats! Super Show!]]'' and ''[[Comedy Bang! Bang! (TV series)|Comedy Bang! Bang!]]'', as well as doing recurring voice work on [[Hulu]]'s ''[[The Awesomes]]'' and [[Disney XD]]'s ''[[Wander Over Yonder]]''. In 2013, Wells starred in the independent film ''Forev'', which premiered at the [[Los Angeles Film Festival]].{{cite web|url=http://filmschoolrejects.com/reviews/forev.php|title=Forev (2013) Movie Review|work=Film School Rejects|accessdate=6 October 2014}} [[File:Noel Wells - Master of None premier.jpg|thumb|left|Wells at the ''Master of None'' premiere]] In 2015, she co-starred on the critically acclaimed [[Netflix]] comedy ''[[Master of None]]'', created by [[Aziz Ansari]] and [[Alan Yang]]. Wells played Rachel, the love-interest of Ansari's character. Hitfix's Alan Sepinwall said the "Dev/Rachel story is so smartly developed, with such strong chemistry between Ansari and Wells”, while Vanity Fair’s Richard Lawson said her portrayal of Rachel was a “star-making...performance. it’s subtle, but not minimalist or deadpan”.{{cite web|title = Watch: Aziz Ansari Navigates Romance in Netflix's 'Master of None' Trailer|url = https://variety.com/2015/digital/news/aziz-ansari-netflix-master-of-none-trailer-1201624300/|website = Variety|accessdate = 2015-10-24}}{{cite news|last1=Sepinwall|first1=Alan|title=Review: Aziz Ansari is a 'Master of None' in fantastic new Netflix comedy |url=http://www.hitfix.com/whats-alan-watching/review-aziz-ansari-is-a-master-of-none-in-fantastic-new-netflix-comedy|accessdate=February 15, 2016|publisher=Hitfix.com|date=November 3, 2015}}{{cite news|last1=Andreeva|first1=Nellie|title=Aziz Ansari Comedy Series A Go At Netflix|url=http://deadline.com/2015/04/aziz-ansari-comedy-series-netflix-1201413974/|accessdate=April 27, 2015|publisher=Deadline.com|date=April 21, 2015}} All 10 episodes premiered on November 6, 2015 and it won the 2016 Critics' Choice Award for Best Comedy.{{cite web|title = Master of None Trailer: Aziz Ansari Gets a Netflix Show|url = http://www.slashfilm.com/master-of-none-trailer/|website = Slashfilm|accessdate = 2015-10-25}}{{cite web|url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt4635276/awards|title=Master of None|date=6 November 2015|publisher=|accessdate=20 December 2016|via=IMDb}} As of August 2015, Wells and partner Flint Wainess are developing a sitcom pilot for [[Comedy Central]] titled ''Bad Couple'', which Wells would star in if ordered to series. Wells and Wainess are also consulting writers on the upcoming [[Netflix]] animated children's series ''[[Green Eggs and Ham (TV series)|Green Eggs and Ham]]'', based on the popular [[Dr. Seuss]] book.{{cite web|last=Wright |first=Megh |url=http://splitsider.com/2015/08/comedy-central-orders-bad-couple-pilot-starring-noel-wells/ |title=Comedy Central Orders ‘Bad Couple’ Pilot Starring Noël Wells |publisher=Splitsider |date=2015-08-03 |accessdate=2016-12-20}} In March 2017, Wells wrote, directed, and starred in the feature film ''[[Mr. Roosevelt (film)|Mr. Roosevelt]]'', which premiered at the [[SXSW]] film festival in Narrative Spotlight. It has won multiple awards including the Audience Award and Louis Black Lone Star Jury Award at SXSW and Best US Narrative Feature at the Traverse City Film Festival.{{cite web|last1=O'Neill|first1=Tyler|title=‘Most Beautiful Island,’ ‘Mr. Roosevelt’ Steal the Show at 2017 SXSW|url=https://www.backstage.com/news/awards-season/most-beautiful-island-mr-roosevelt-steal-show-2017-sxsw/|website=Backstage.com}}{{cite news|url=https://variety.com/2017/film/news/sxsw-2017-audience-award-winners-1202011563/|title=SXSW Announces 2017 Audience Award Winners|date=|work=|last1=Kelley|first1=Seth|accessdate=May 4, 2017}} She is now the voice of Kelsey Bern in the Cartoon Network series ''[[Craig of the Creek]]'' since the episode "The Final Book". ==Personal life== Wells is an avid photographer and has had her photography featured in exhibitions and the literary magazine ''[[Oxford American]]''.{{cite web|title=Oxford American Best of the South|url=https://www.flickr.com/photos/prettypertelote/4658133738/|website=Flickr|publisher=Noel Wells|accessdate=July 15, 2014}} She has lived in [[Los Angeles]] and [[New York City]].{{cite web|last1=Tuck|first1=Lauren|title=5 Things You Need to Know About 'SNL' New Girl|url=https://shine.yahoo.com/photos/5-things-you-need-to-know-about-snl-s-new-girl-slideshow/noel-wells-loves-cats-photo-1378929918067.html|website=Yahoo|accessdate=July 15, 2014}}{{cite web |last1=Isaac |first1=Jessica |title=Master of None's Noël Wells' Vibrant and Personal LA Rental |url=https://www.apartmenttherapy.com/master-of-none-noel-wells-house-tour-photos-255547 |website=Apartment Therapy}} ==Filmography== ===Film=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Year ! Title ! Role ! class="unsortable"|Notes |- |2013 | ''Forev'' | Sophie | |- |2016 | ''[[Dreamland (2016 film)|Dreamland]]'' | Joanna | |- |2017 | ''[[The Incredible Jessica James]]'' | Tasha | |- |2017 | ''[[Infinity Baby]]'' | Theresa | |- |2017 | ''[[Mr. Roosevelt (film)|Mr. Roosevelt]]'' | Emily Martin | Also writer and director |- |2018 | ''[[Happy Anniversary (2018 film)|Happy Anniversary]]'' | Mollie | |- |2018 | ''[[Social Animals]]'' | Zoe | |- |2018 | ''The Adventures of Drunky'' | (voice) | Post-production |- |} ===Television=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Year ! Title ! Role ! class="unsortable"|Notes |- | 2013 | ''[[The Aquabats! Super Show!]]'' | Rachel Moonbug | Episode: "The Anti-Bats!" |- | 2013–14 |''[[Saturday Night Live]]'' | Featured player | [[Saturday Night Live (season 39)|Season 39]] |- | 2014 | ''[[The Awesomes]]'' | Cait Walker / Knight Light | Voice role; 3 episodes |- | 2014–16 | ''Gentleman Lobsters'' | Shell | Voice role; 7 episodes |- | 2015 | ''[[Comedy Bang! Bang! (TV series)|Comedy Bang! Bang!]]'' | Aiden Tomasseto | Episode: "Kid Cudi Wears a Denim Shirt and Red Sneakers" |- | 2015–16 | ''[[Wander Over Yonder]]'' | Lord Dominator | Voice; 13 episodes |- | 2015, 2017 | ''[[Master of None]]'' | Rachel Silva | Main Role |- | 2016 | ''[[The UCB Show]]'' | Trish/Willow | Episode: "Feel the Bern" |- | 2016 | ''[[Loosely Exactly Nicole]]'' | Blix | Episode: "Big Break" |- | 2016 | ''[[American Dad!]]'' | DreamSmith Entertainment Announcer | Voice role; Episode: "Fight and Flight" |- | 2017 | ''[[Elena of Avalor]]'' | Marimonda | Voice role; Episode: "Realm of the Jacquins" |- | 2018– | ''[[Craig of the Creek]]'' | Kelsey | Voice role; Main role |} == Awards and Nominations == {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |- ! Year ! Award ! Category ! Work ! Result |- | rowspan="8"| 2017 | [[AFI Fest|AFI Fest Awards]] | Audience Award for American Independents | rowspan="8"| ''[[Mr. Roosevelt]]'' | {{nom}} |- | [[BendFilm Festival|BendFilm Festival Awards]] | Best Narrative Feature | {{won}} |- | [[Dallas International Film Festival|Dallas International Film Festival Awards]] | Grand Jury Prize for Texan Competition | {{won}} |- | [[Denver International Film Festival|Denver International Film Festival Awards]] | American Independent Award for Best Feature Film | {{nom}} |- | rowspan="3"|[[South by Southwest|South by Southwest Film Awards]] | Louis Black Lone Star Award for Best Texan Film | {{won}} |- | Audience Award for Narrative Spotlight | {{won}} |- | SXSW Gamechanger Award | {{nom}} |- | [[Traverse City Film Festival|Traverse City Film Festival Awards]] | Founders Prize for Best US Fiction | {{won}} |} ==References== {{Reflist|colwidth=30em}} ==External links== * {{officialsite|http://noelwells.com}} * {{IMDb name|nm3644706}} * [http://www.cracked.com/members/noel/ User Profile] at [[Cracked.com]] * [https://www.flickr.com/photos/prettypertelote/ Photography page] at [[Flickr]] {{authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Wells, Noel}} [[Category:1986 births]] [[Category:21st-century American actresses]] [[Category:Actresses from San Antonio]] [[Category:American impressionists (entertainers)]] [[Category:American people of Tunisian descent]] [[Category:American photographers]] [[Category:American sketch comedians]] [[Category:American television actresses]] [[Category:American women comedians]] [[Category:American women screenwriters]] [[Category:Hispanic and Latino American actresses]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:University of Texas at Austin alumni]] [[Category:American people of Mexican descent]] [[Category:Upright Citizens Brigade Theater performers]]
